H0.text: Electric current is the phenomenon taking place inside an active hot pack, which releases heat when the chemicals inside it interact.

H1.text: A net loss of mass is taking place inside an active hot pack that releases heat when the chemicals inside it interact.

H2.text: Thermal insulation is taking place inside an active hot pack, a product that releases heat when chemicals inside of it interact.

H3.text: An exothermic reaction is taking place inside an active hot pack when the chemicals inside it interact and release heat.

A4.text: Combustion of natural gas releases heat: CH4 + 2O2 → CO2 + 2H2O ΔH° = - 890 kJ/mol.
